contentrichtext.text: '''Ambassador''' was an [[automobile]] produced by the [[Yellow Cab|Yellow Cab Manufacturing Company]] of [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], [[United States|U.S.]], between 1921 and 1925. == History == Initially sold for use as a [[taxicab]], the Model D-1 was introduced as a "drive-yourself" model in 1924. Yellow Cab introduced the "Ambassador" in 1921 and "explained that this car was being made up to order".<ref>{{cite book|title=Automotive industries, the automobile, Volume 48|year=1923|publisher=Class Journal Co.|page=211}}</ref> The Ambassador was available as a 4-passenger sport or 7-passenger touring for [[United States dollar|US$]]4,500, as well as a Berlin limousine or sedan for $6,500.<ref>{{cite book|title=Official Handbook of Automobiles|year=2010|publisher=Morison Press|isbn=978-1-4455-7465-3|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=ZU1nQ3CME8MC&pg=PT35&dq=Yellow+Cab+Ambassador+Chicago|accessdate=25 October 2010}}</ref> All featured a {{convert|136|in|mm|0|adj=on}} [[wheelbase]] and a special 6-cylinder Continental L-head ([[Flathead engine]]) engine.<ref>{{cite journal|title=New cars on the American market|journal=The American Exporter|year=1921|month=September|volume=89|issue=3|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=P1hLAAAAYAAJ&pg=RA2-PA127&dq=Yellow+Cab+Ambassador+Chicago|accessdate=25 October 2010|page=127}}</ref> In 1925 Yellow Cab was taken over by [[General Motors]]. [[John D. Hertz]] remained as president and the Ambassador D-1 model became the "Hertz". Apart from a larger engine in 1927, production continued with little change until 1928. Most were sedans, although other body styles were available.<ref>{{cite book|last=Baldwin|first=Nick |first2=Brian |last2=Laban|title=The World guide to automobile manufacturers|year=1987|publisher=Facts on File Publications|isbn=978-0-8160-1844-4|page=220}}</ref> Yellow Cab eventually became [[The Hertz Corporation|Hertz Rent A Car]]. == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Vehicles introduced in 1921]] [[Category:1920s automobiles]] [[Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Sedans]] [[Category:Taxicab vehicles]] {{Vintage-auto-stub}}
